Derives one or more outcome variable(s) from repeated measures data

Source: R/make-outcome.R
dh.makeOutcome.Rd

Many analyses will want to use outcomes derived at a single time point, e.g. BMI between ages 10-14. This function automates the process to do this which is quite complex in DataSHIELD. Note that for big datasets this takes a long time to run.

dh.makeOutcome(
  df = NULL,
  outcome = NULL,
  age_var = NULL,
  bands = NULL,
  mult_action = NULL,
  mult_vals = NULL,
  keep_original = FALSE,
  df_name = NULL,
  conns = NULL,
  id_var = "child_id",
  band_action = NULL
)

Arguments

df

opal dataframe
outcome

name of repeated measures outcome variable
age_var

Vector of values indicating pairs of low and high values for which to derive outcome variables for. Must be even length
bands

vector of alternating lower and upper age bands for variable(s) you want to create. Variables will be derived for the age range > lowest value and <= highest value for each band.
mult_action

if a subject has more than one value within the time period do we keep the earliest or latest? Default = "earliest"
mult_vals

if "mult_action = nearest", this argument specifies which which value in each age band to chose values closest to in case of multiple values
keep_original

keep original data frame in the DataSHIELD backend
df_name

specify data frame name on the DataSHIELD backend
conns

connections object for DataSHIELD backends
id_var

specify id variable (default assumes LifeCycle name 'child_id')
band_action

specify how the values of bands are evaluated in making the subsets. "g_l" = greater than the lowest band and less than the highest band; "ge_le" = greater or equal to the lowest band and less than or equal to the highest band; "g_le" = greater than the lowest band and less than or equal to the highest band; "ge_l" = greater than or equal to the lowest band and less than the highest band;

Value

a dataset containing the newly derived variables

Contents
